pageContext.claim: “I don't mean they're off by a little bit, they're up by 20%, 25%. There's fraud, there's missing ballots.”
pageContext.analysis: In elections held primarily by mail, it's not unusual that 5 percent of ballots or more might be rejected. (Trump exaggerates by claiming anywhere from 20 to 25 percent of ballots are affected.) These rejections are almost all because of mismatched signatures, failure to sign an affidavit, or another deficiency in the ballot -- not because of fraud.
